content:
ItemChangedEventHandler Delegate

In this Article

Represents the method that will handle the ItemChanged event of the CurrencyManager class.

Syntax

Declaration

public delegate void ItemChangedEventHandler(object sender, ItemChangedEventArgs e);

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • System.Delegate
  • ItemChangedEventHandler

Remarks

When you create an ItemChangedEventHandler delegate, you identify the method that will handle the event. To associate the event with your event handler, add an instance of the delegate to the event. The event handler is called whenever the event occurs, unless you remove the delegate. For more information about event handler delegates, see Events.
